column4: hey there; 1 question: i installed 12.04; how do I get back my personal key(s) ?
Which personal keys?
gpg
Did you reinstall Ubuntu?
Did you format your home partition (if you had one) while reinstalling Ubuntu?
I did after I backed it up (was deleting some folders & files i no longer need; hope i didn't mess it up!). what should I look for?
You should look for your key files then, in your backup.
.asc ?
.asc is just your ascii fingerprint.
By default, gpg stores its keys in ~/.gnupg/
found it :D now what?
Did you search in your backup?
Then copy them backup to your ~/.gnupg/
all files? (.conf|.gpg|)? replace the ones in my current home? (what would happen to contents of the currents?)
When overwriting files, the overwritten file content is lost. Thats what happens when overwriting files. :)
I do know that, hehe; I meant don't they contain anything imp? or just default files?
The existing files are default files.
done
Use gpg as you used it before.
THANKS :D
had I lost them what could have I done?
Nothing. Loosing your private key means you have no chance to recover it.
oh; glad I backed up my home then, not just my selected folders!
you're welcome
